document_data.name: Cable
document_data.mainbody: '''Cable''' was a term describing several distinct manufactured products, similar to common [[rope]], though on occasion was confusingly also used to refer to common rope.
document_data.Availability:
* [[Tantras]] was a center of rope production, and thick hawser cables could be had for 150 [[gp]] per {{SI|100|ft|long=yes}} (this was the exorbitant price set by shops when a ship cable was required immediately in emergency, rather than ordered normally).{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2004)/General Facts on Tantras}}
* [[Urcandle Alley]] in [[Waterdeep]] sold all manner of ropes, including thick cables.
* [[Nueth's Fine Nets]] in Waterdeep sold a variety of useful implements used on ships, including thin, [[wax]]ed, wire-cored climbing cable favored by [[thieves]] for 30 [[gp]] per {{SI|120|ft|long=yes}}.
* The [[Chandlers Guild]] of [[Ravens Bluff]] oversaw the city's maritime tools and equipment, including the development of new kinds of wired cable.
* [[Rallogar Hardware]] in [[Wheloon]] sold tools and supplies, including rope, cable, and wire.
document_data.Notable Instances:
* [[Winch]]ed heavy cables installed by [[dwarf|dwarven]] artisans were used to guide and control the passage of shipping on the [[River Chionthar]] at [[Berdusk]], as the [[Breaking Steps]] rapids nearby made normal water travel impossible.
* The [[earthmote]]s of [[Airspur]] were connected by suspension bridges that used metal cabling.
* The bridge to [[Sadrach's Splinter]] was supported by crystalline cables.
document_data.Magic:
* Spells that were normally used with ropes such as ''[[bind]]'', ''[[knot]]'', ''[[tie]]'', and ''[[animate rope]]'' could manipulate even very heavy cables.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards}}
* A ''[[rod of sylvan prowess]]'' could launch a line of [[steel]] cable, intended to affix to a surface and carry people and cargo.
document_data.History: Wire-cored cable was first developed in the Realms around the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].
